title: Elementary English 204
headline: This free online basic English course explains modal verbs and provides vocabulary relating to the body and medicine.
description: This course covers essential vocabulary you need to know while visiting a doctor or describing a medical condition. We outline various forms of modal verbs and explain how to use each modal verb in sentences. Using audio and video assets, we help you develop your reading and listening skills which will enhance your language ability before you tackle the speaking and writing activities included in this course. Don't delay; enroll today!
courseDescription:
This course was designed to develop and enhance your English skills and will help you gain confidence in your ability. Several videos and auditory assets are included to assist your pronunciation and understanding at each step so you feel assured and supported while learning the language.
We begin with vocabulary related to various parts of the body, followed by a topic examining words and phrases needed to explain certain conditions or terms commonly used in the medical field.

Once you have a solid understanding of these terms, we use them to develop your grammar skills. We start by reviewing modal verbs and focus on each modal verb's function. We examine the modal verbs 'can' and 'can't,' typically used to talk about ability and possibility, and then teach you how to use them to form questions with these modal verbs. We also explore the modals 'could,' 'should,' and 'shouldn't' and learn how to use them when asking for advice or making recommendations.

The final section offers reading and listening comprehension activities that reinforce the vocabulary and grammar you have learned throughout the course. We encourage speaking practice using the 'Ask and Answer' video footage before urging you to complete a downloadable writing exercise found in the 'Resources' section. If you want to improve your English ability, this course can provide the skills, courage, and confidence you need when speaking, reading, and writing in English.
